title: Dimension Templates Page
text: This is where you can create and maintain all the Dimension Templates, Dimension Values and Dimension Names [or Sets]. Sometimes collectively referred to as Size Patterns. A Dimension Template is where you have one or several Dimension Names or sets. You can set up a variation of Dimension types such as Colour, Size, weight or an alternative. Dimension Template Group - This is the Dimension Group title where the Dimension Values sit within. Dimension Value - Is the value information of size, age, weight or any other value of which an item is distinguished. Below are some examples of Templates, Names and Values setup for easier selection when creating items. JNR CLOTHING SIZES NAME NAME VALUES Jnr XS to L JSX - JS - JM - JL Jnr Age 8yr - 10yr - 12yr - 14yr Jnr Age Combi 4/6yr - 8/10yr - 12/14yr ADULT CLOTHING SIZES NAME VALUES S - XL S - M - L - XL XS - XL XS - S - M - L - XL - 2XL 10-16 10 - 12 - 14 - 16 FOOTWEAR SIZES NAME VALUES Jnr Whole 4 - 5 - 6 - 8 - 9 Jnr Half Sizes 4 - 4x - 5 - 5x - 6 - 6x - 7 - 7x - 8 - 8x - 9 Adl Euro Whole 38 - 39 - 40 - 41 - 42 - 43 - 44
description:
This is where you can create and maintain all the Dimension Templates, Dimension Values and Dimension Names [or Sets]. 

Sometimes collectively referred to as Size Patterns.


A Dimension Template is where you have one or several Dimension Names or sets. 


You can set up a variation of Dimension types such as Colour, Size, weight or an alternative.

  • Dimension Template Group - This is the Dimension Group title where the Dimension Values sit within.
  • Dimension Value -  Is the value information of size, age, weight or any other value of which an item is distinguished.

Below are some examples of Templates, Names and Values setup for easier selection when creating items.


JNR CLOTHING SIZES NAME

Jnr XS to LJSX - JS - JM - JL

title: Creating a Dimension Template
text: When you first begin, if you have no templates set up you will see the below page. Click on the add template button, and type the name of the Dimension Group you require. Click next this will then take you to add a Dimension Value. Type in the Value and choose which Dimension Type the value is to be assigned to. Eg, NAME: Jnr XS to L / VALUE: Size Click Add Dimension, you will be taken to the Dimension Template Groups page. From here you can add, edit or delete more Dimension Values using the buttons to the right of the table. To Add Values click the + icon this will make the Value Box available. Type in the Value E.g. XS and click the save icon. The Name (Jnr XS to L) will now become the parent name and become a drop-down style menu to display the values. NOTE: The order of values can be rearranged by dragging them up and down the list using the situated to the left. To create another template click name the Dimension Template and press save. The Dimension Template will now be available for selection as one of the pre-defined Templates within the Dimensions section when in Item Creation.
description:
When you first begin, if you have no templates set up you will see the below page. 



Click on the add template button, and type the name of the Dimension Group you require. 



Click next this will then take you to add a Dimension Value.


Type in the Value and choose which Dimension Type the value is to be assigned to. Eg, NAME: Jnr XS to L /  VALUE: Size



Click Add Dimension, you will be taken to the Dimension Template Groups page. 



From here you can add, edit or delete more Dimension Values using the buttons to the right of the table. 

To Add Values click the + icon this will make the Value Box available.

Type in the Value E.g. XS and click the save icon.



The Name (Jnr XS to L) will now become the parent name and become a drop-down style menu to display the values.

NOTE: The order of values can be rearranged by dragging them up and down the list using the situated to the left. 



To create another template click name the Dimension Template and press save.

The Dimension Template will now be available for selection as one of the pre-defined Templates within the Dimensions section when in Item Creation.

title: Editing an Existing Dimension Template
text: Using the Template drop-down, select the template and click the edit button. Change the Dimension Template name and click the Save button. The name will update and be displayed in the drop-down and above the value tables. From here you can add, edit or delete more Dimension Values using the buttons to the right of the table. To Add Values click the + this will make the Value Box available. Type in the Value and click the save icon to save.
description:
Using the Template drop-down, select the template and click the edit button. 



Change the Dimension Template name and click the Save button.



The name will update and be displayed in the drop-down and above the value tables.



From here you can add, edit or delete more Dimension Values using the buttons to the right of the table. 

To Add Values click the + this will make the Value Box available.

Type in the Value and click the save icon to save.

title: Dimension Types
text: Dimension types are a way of setting the heading for your Dimensions that then work in hand with Dimension Templates. These headings will then be shown in the Item properties and for reporting. A maximum of 10 dimension types can be created. Commonly used dimension types are Colour, Size, Fit and Weight. If required these can be broken down further in the Dimension Template page as Clothing Colours, Footwear Colours or Supplier ABC Colours. For Sizes and Weights, it might be Clothing Sizes, Footwear Sizes, Imperial Weights or Metric Weights. Add a Dimension Type Click on Let's add your first type. Enter the description of your dimension type e.g. SIZE. Clicking next will then take you to the main page for adding, editing and deleting types. You will see the Size set as Sequence 1. NOTE: Dimension Sequence is the order in which you wish the dimension type to appear in a drop-down list, starting at 1. You can add more types by pressing the + this will add another line for a dimension type, you can add up to a maximum of 10. NOTE: You cannot have the same Dimension Type twice. If this occurs you will be shown the warning seen below. Once you have entered a unique Dimension Type click this will save the name and be added as sequence 2. You can change the sequence number to suit your requirements. To delete a Dimension Type click the bin icon. NOTE: A dimension type should not be deleted whilst there are active dimension templates and dimensions assigned. To edit any Dimension Types click the pencil icon once edited click the save icon.
description:
Dimension types are a way of setting the heading for your Dimensions that then work in hand with Dimension Templates. 

These headings will then be shown in the Item properties and for reporting. A maximum of 10 dimension types can be created.

Commonly used dimension types are Colour, Size, Fit and Weight. 

If required these can be broken down further in the Dimension Template page as Clothing Colours, Footwear Colours or Supplier ABC Colours.  For Sizes and Weights, it might be Clothing Sizes, Footwear Sizes, Imperial Weights or Metric Weights. 


Add a Dimension Type

Click on Let's add your first type.



Enter the description of your dimension type e.g. SIZE.



Clicking next will then take you to the main page for adding, editing and deleting types. You will see the Size set as Sequence 1.

NOTE: Dimension Sequence is the order in which you wish the dimension type to appear in a drop-down list, starting at 1.



You can add more types by pressing the + this will add another line for a dimension type, you can add up to a maximum of 10.



NOTE: You cannot have the same Dimension Type twice. If this occurs you will be shown the warning seen below. 



Once you have entered a unique Dimension Type click this will save the name and be added as sequence 2.

You can change the sequence number to suit your requirements. 



To delete a Dimension Type click the bin icon. 

NOTE: A dimension type should not be deleted whilst there are active dimension templates and dimensions assigned.

To edit any Dimension Types click the pencil icon once edited click the save icon.
